name: GetAsanaProjectTemplates
description:
Fetch project template records from Asana.

Retrieve compact project template records for all templates in a specified team or workspace within Asana. This requires the 'project_templates:read' scope.

parameters.name: workspace_identifier
parameters.description: The identifier of the workspace to filter project templates results on.

value_schema.description: The workspace to filter results on.

parameters.name: team_filter
parameters.description: The team ID to filter project templates on.

value_schema.description: The team to filter projects on.

parameters.name: results_per_page
parameters.description: Specify the number of project templates to return per page, between 1 and 100.

value_schema.description:
Results per page.
The number of objects to return per page. The value must be between 1 and 100.

parameters.name: pagination_offset_token
parameters.description: Offset token for pagination. Use the token returned from a previous request to fetch the next page of results. If omitted, the first page is returned.

value_schema.description:
Offset token.
An offset to the next page returned by the API. A pagination request will return an offset token, which can be used as an input parameter to the next request. If an offset is not passed in, the API will return the first page of results.
*Note: You can only pass in an offset that was returned to you via a previously paginated request.*

parameters.name: include_optional_fields
parameters.description: A list of optional properties to include in the response. Provide as an array of strings, with each string representing a property name.

value_schema.description: This endpoint returns a resource which excludes some properties by default. To include those optional properties, set this query parameter to a comma-separated list of the properties you wish to include.

parameters.name: pretty_output
parameters.description: Set to true to enable pretty JSON formatting for debugging, despite increased size and time.

value_schema.description:
Provides “pretty” output.
Provides the response in a “pretty” format. In the case of JSON this means doing proper line breaking and indentation to make it readable. This will take extra time and increase the response size so it is advisable only to use this during debugging.

metadata.description: Tools that enable LLMs to interact directly with the asana API.

parameters.name: workspace
parameters.description: The workspace to filter results on.

value_schema.description: The workspace to filter results on.

parameters.name: team
parameters.description: The team to filter projects on.

value_schema.description: The team to filter projects on.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description:
Results per page.
The number of objects to return per page. The value must be between 1 and 100.

value_schema.description:

*Note: You can only pass in an offset that was returned to you via a previously paginated request.*
